name: website
body:
## hello
I'm studying software engineering at University of Waterloo. I'm a quick learner with a positive attitude who loves to build software and get things done. I love working with algorithms and learning about new technology that can prove to be quite useful. My goal is to one day build an online service with a huge impact in the world and benefit everyone. In my spare time, I like to travel, play sports or party with friends. 

## experience

### A Thinking Ape - Software Developer (Co-op)
Took on Android and Web applications while using cloud based IDE. Revamped server code to send HTML emails and self-start unsubscribe unstable email addresses. Set up phabricator (code inspection) and jenkins (continuous integration) servers

### Khan Academy - Software Engineer Intern
Systematized issues filed against the khan-exercises architecture on GitHub. Developed Python/Flask server endpoint to store and tag teacher-written questions. Co-developed front-end for instructors to draft, edit and tag questions

### Pivotal Labs - Android Developer
Designed web user interface with Twitter Bootstrap and AngularJS. Collaborated in an agile, pair-programming, test-driven-development environment. Developed a template engine for rapid development and automatic scaffolding of mobile apps that use RESTful APIs

## projects
Wrote an app to visualize combinatorial graphs and their algorithms through an interactive graph builder. Created a RESTful graph retrieval and storage API with ngRoute

### Essence
Source: Github
Link: not yet ready
Technologies: MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS, Node.js,
D3.js, HTML, SASS 

### Contact
bxlou@uwaterloo.ca
twitter @bryanlou3
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
